DELETE.ARE_YOU_SURE: Are you sure that you want to delete '{label}'? This action cannot be undone.

WARNINGS.DUPLICATE_ID: A bonus with that identifier already exists!
WARNINGS.MISSING_TARGET: You must designate where the bonus should apply!
WARNINGS.MISSING_ITEM_TYPES: You must select at least one item type!
WARNINGS.MISSING_ABILITY_TYPES: You must select at least one ability!
WARNINGS.MISSING_FILTER: Your bonus needs at least one filter!
WARNINGS.MISSING_THROW_TYPES: You must select at least one type of saving throw!

TITLES.TOGGLE_THIS:
Toggle this bonus on or off.
A bonus that is toggled off will be completely ignored, even if it is an aura.
TITLES.COPY_THIS:
Copy this bonus into the builder.
This clears all fields before adding all data from this bonus.
TITLES.EDIT_THIS:
Edit this bonus in the builder.
This clears all fields before adding all the data from this bonus.
TITLES.DELETE_THIS:
Delete this bonus from this document.
Deletion is permanent and the bonus cannot be recovered.
TITLES.IDENTIFIERS:
Identifying information of the bonus.
The label is for your convenience, while the identifier is used to refer to the bonus internally and can only contain hyphens and lowercase letters.
TITLES.TARGETS: What the bonus should apply to, such as Attack Rolls, Damage Rolls, or the Save DC of an item.
TITLES.WHEN_TARGETED: If checked, the bonus will apply to actors that target you, instead of to yourself.
TITLES.DESCRIPTION: A description of the bonus for your convenience.
TITLES.ITEM_TYPES: The types of items the bonus should apply to.
TITLES.SAVE_BONUS: An integer to add onto the DC of a saving throw. This field respects roll data properties, such as @abilities.int.mod, but not dice rolls such as 1d4.
TITLES.CRITICAL_RANGE: An integer to subtract from the critical range of the attack roll. This field respects roll data properties such as @abilities.int.mod, but not dice rolls such as 1d4.
TITLES.DEATH_SAVE_TARGET_VALUE: An integer to subtract from the minimum requirement to pass a death saving throw. This field respects roll data properties such as @abilities.int.mod, but not dice rolls such as 1d4.
TITLES.ATTACK_BONUS: Additional parts to add on top of the attack roll such as 1d4 or @scale.rogue.sneak-attack.
TITLES.FUMBLE_RANGE: An integer to add to the fumble range of the attack roll. This field respects roll data properties such as @abilities.int.mod, but not dice rolls such as 1d4.
TITLES.DAMAGE_BONUS: Additional parts to add on top of the damage roll such as 1d4 or @scale.rogue.sneak-attack.
TITLES.CRIT_BONUS_DICE: An additional number of dice that should be rolled on a critical hit. This field respects roll data properties such as @abilities.int.mod, but not dice rolls such as 1d4.
TITLES.CRIT_BONUS_DAMAGE: Additional parts to add on top of the damage roll on critical hits such as 1d4 or @scale.rogue.sneak-attack.
TITLES.THROW_BONUS: Additional parts to add on top of the saving throw such as 1d4 or @scale.rogue.sneak-attack.
TITLES.HITDIE_BONUS: Additional parts to add on top of the hit die roll such as 1d4 or @scale.rogue.sneak-attack.
TITLES.ARBITRARY_COMPARISON:
Insert numbers, roll data properties, strings, or a combination of the three, that must be in this relationship for the bonus to apply.
This comparison can evaluate substrings by using either of the inequalities.
TITLES.ITEM_SPECIFIC: Whether the bonus from this item should require being equipped or attuned to apply to the actor.
TITLES.THROW_TYPES: The type of saving throw the bonus should apply to.
TITLES.DAMAGE_TYPES: The type of damage the item must deal for the bonus to apply.
TITLES.ABILITIES: The ability score used by the item.
TITLES.ACTOR_CONDITIONS: The conditions the actor must be affected by. For example blind;charm will mean you only get this bonus while either blinded or charmed.
TITLES.TARGET_CONDITIONS: The conditions the target actor must be affected by. For example blind;charm will mean you only get this bonus while your target is either blinded or charmed.
TITLES.ATTACK_TYPES: The type of attack roll the item must have for the bonus to apply.
TITLES.SAVE_ABILITIES: The ability that must be used to set the saving throw DC of the item for the bonus to apply. This can be different from the ability the item otherwise uses. If an item is set to scale with Spellcasting, the actor's spellcasting ability is compared against.
TITLES.SPELL_COMPONENTS: The components the spell must have for the bonus to apply. You can choose whether the spell must have all of the given components, or at least one of them.
TITLES.SPELL_LEVELS: The level at which the spell must be cast for the bonus to apply. Select each level individually.
TITLES.SPELL_SCHOOLS: The school the spell must belong to for the bonus to apply.
TITLES.WEAPON_TYPES: The type of weapon the item must be for the bonus to apply.
TITLES.WEAPON_PROPERTIES: The weapon properties the item either must have or cannot have for the bonus to apply. The weapon must have at least one of the needed properties, and none of the unfit properties.
TITLES.AURA_ENABLED:
Whether this bonus should transfer to other token actors on a scene.
A bonus transferred to another actor will still be evaluated against the filters below.
TITLES.AURA_RANGE: The range of the aura, measured in feet (put in -1 for an unlimited range), or if the aura affects the area within a Measured Template instead (for items).
TITLES.AURA_TEMPLATE: Whether this aura affects token actors within the area of a Measured Template, rather than token actors within a range of this item's owner.
TITLES.AURA_FIELDS: Which targets should benefit from the aura, and whether the aura should affect its owner as well.
TITLES.AURA_BLOCKERS:
The status conditions that block an aura from being transferred, such as a paladin's aura that is only active while the paladin is neither dead nor unconscious.
This has no effect if the aura is on a Measured Template.

KEY.ITEM_TYPES_DESC: Select any item type that this bonus should apply to. You must select at least one.
KEY.ABILITIES_DESC: Select the ability score that is used by the item. This filter respects spellcasting abilities, finesse weapons, and default values.
KEY.SAVE_ABILITIES_DESC: Select the ability score that is used by the item to set the saving throw's DC. This filter respects spellcasting abilities.
KEY.ATTACK_TYPES_DESC: Select the type of attack the item must have for the bonus to apply.
KEY.DAMAGE_TYPES_DESC: Select a damage type. If the item has a formula with at least one of the selected damage types, the bonus will apply.
KEY.COMPONENTS_DESC: Select any spell component that the item must have. You can choose whether the spell must have all or at least one of the selected options.
KEY.SPELL_LEVELS_DESC: Select the spell levels that the bonus should apply to. This is the level at which the spell was cast, not the base level.
KEY.SPELL_SCHOOLS_DESC: Select the spell schools that the spell must be a member of.
KEY.ACTOR_CONDITIONS_DESC: Select the status conditions that the actor must be afflicted by. The bonus will apply if the actor is afflicted by at least one of the selected conditions.
KEY.TARGET_CONDITIONS_DESC: Select the status conditions that the target actor must be afflicted by. The bonus will apply if the target actor is afflicted by at least one of the selected conditions.
KEY.WEAPONS_DESC: Select the type of weapons that the bonus should apply to.
KEY.PROPERTIES_DESC: Select weapon properties that should be required for the weapon (the bonus will apply if the weapon has at least one of them) or any properties that must not appear on the weapon.
KEY.THROW_TYPES_DESC: Select the types of saving throws the bonus should apply to.
KEY.AURA_BLOCKERS_DESC: Select the status conditions that will prevent the benefits of the aura from being transferred to the actor and other actors.

TRAITS.NAME: Build-a-Bonus Workshop
TRAITS.HINT: Open the Build-a-Bonus workshop. Here you can create situational bonuses that should apply automatically for various rolls, such as saving throws, damage rolls, and hit die rolls.
TRAITS.LABEL: Build-a-Bonus Workshop

DISPLAY_LABEL.NAME: Display Label
DISPLAY_LABEL.HINT: If checked, the label is displayed in the header of applicable items and effects.
